meanings.definition: To frown more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outfrowning her sister during the argument.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to win by outfrowning his opponents.
meanings.sent3: The outfrowning contest between the two siblings was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her dark clouds of outfrowning overshadowed the room.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's outfrowning face made a lasting impression on everyone.

meanings.definition: To show disapproval or displeasure by frowning outwardly.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was outfrowning at the students' unruly behavior.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help outfrowning when she heard the disappointing news.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave an outfrowning look when it saw the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were outfrowning at the approaching ships.
meanings.sent5: His outfrowning expression made it clear he was not pleased with the situation.
